page.title: 16An Educational Visit.
page.content: After spending the morning on a study of Cheddleton Church we arrived at Stanley Head Outdoor Education Centre in time for lunch.We ate in a converted cowshed. After lunch we went into one of the classrooms where we were given our instructions for the afternoon's work. We were divided into pairs and given an Ordnance Survey map showing the grounds of Stanley Head.On the map there were several points showing the positions of some patterns of nails.These patterns could be found on;tree stumps,telegraph poles,window frames etc. We were given a piece of paper and a thick wax crayon to trace over the various nail patterns as we found them. The winners were the first pair to complete the exercise correctly in the shortest time.
